12.text:
12 (a)  
[2 marks: 1 AO2.1a, 1 AO2.3b]  
• B1 for 4 × 4 dotted squares correct  
• B1 for 4 blocks of 4 black squares correct  

12 (b)  
[2 marks: 1 AO1.3a, 1 AO2.1a]  
• M1 for 8 × 8 or 8² or “8 squared”  

12 (c)  
[2 marks: 1 AO1.3a, 1 AO2.3a]  
• M1 for 4, 8, 12 seen  

12 (d)  
Number of blacks is always even (oe) and reason  
Number of dots alternates between odd and even (oe) and reason  

• even + even = even  
• odd + even = odd  

Marks for (d): B1, B1, B1, B1, B1, B1  
[2 AO2.2, 4 AO2.4b]  

Guidance for (d):  
• Accept “4 times table” or “4 is even.”  
• Accept any reason that has explanatory value, e.g. odd² = odd.  
• If 0 scored, instead award:  
  – B1 shows true for patterns 1, 2 and 3  
  – B1 shows true for at least two more patterns

18.text:
Answer (Question 18):

Average speed = Distance / Time = x/5 km/h  
= 1000x / (60² × 5) m/s  
= 1000x / 18000 m/s (oe)  
= x/18 m/s  

Marks: 4  (2 AO1.3a, 2 AO2.2)

Part marks and guidance:
• B1 for x km = 1000x m  
• B1 for 5 hours = 60² × 5 s  
• B1 for working to given answer without intermediate expression or statement of formula

19.text:
19    Answer: 25 with correct working [5 marks]  
 (2 AO1.3b, 3 AO3.1d)  

• M1 for 10 × (2 / 5) = 4 litres red  
   or for 10 × (3 / 5) = 6 litres white  

• M1 for red costs £8 per litre  
   or for white costs £0.50 per litre  

• M1 for cost of one 10‑litre can is  
   (their 4 × their 8) + (their 6 × their 0.5)  

• M1 for 60 – their 35  

• If 0 or 1 scored, instead award SC2 for answer 25 with no working or insufficient working  

“Correct working” requires evidence of at least M1M1  

Alternative method:  
• M1 for 2 : 3 = 20 litres red : 30 litres white  
• M1 for (2 × £80) + (3 × £5) = £175  
• M1 for (their 175) ÷ 5 = 35  
• M1 for 60 – their 35
